title: Senator Brags About Killing Flock Of Cockatoos, Gets Justifiably Roasted Online
text:
Thanks for signing up!

Old people share the dumbest shit.

Liberal Senator James McGrath has proven this theory correct – he came under fire this weekend after sharing a picture of, and subsequently bragging about, a dead cockatoo trapped in his car.

“Car 1. Flock of cockatoos 0,” Senator McGrath gloated to his Facebook on Friday.

Car 1. Flock of cockatoos 0. Posted by Senator James McGrath on Friday, 4 October 2019

The post subsequently garnered widespread criticism from online punters, many of whom were justifiably confused as to why Senator McGrath felt the need to boast about killing native wildlife.

Oh look – a Liberal Senator bragging about killing native wildlife with his car. Ripper stuff. pic.twitter.com/dOiFZ7Nx8g — Sally Rugg (@sallyrugg) October 6, 2019

Facebook hides the total number of reactions but safe to say this hasn't gone well for James McGrath. pic.twitter.com/tXItbGpION — Pat Caruana (@patbcaruana) October 6, 2019

READ MORE SA Cop Under Investigation After Allegedly Killing Wombat In Brutal Video

“This photo really proves a lack of compassion and respect for our precious, unique wildlife. You’ve definitely lost my vote Senator,” one Facebook user commented.

“Mate, that bird is a native Aussie. To love Australia is to love, respect and protect our native flora and fauna,” said another.

READ MORE 19 Y.O. Charged After Alleged Massacre Of 20 Roos And Joeys On NSW South Coast

He’s yet to comment about his lil’ scandal. Judging from the Queenslander’s past tasteful Tweets, though, he probably doesn’t give a shit.

Darth Vader has been joined by some mates in my Canberra office. If this doesn’t annoy the greenies then I really need to try harder. #auspol #taxidermy pic.twitter.com/4PjmussPIL — Senator James McGrath (@SenatorMcGrath) February 11, 2018

Seems like such a pleasant dude.
description: Senator James McGrath has come under fire this weekend after sharing a picture of, and subsequently bragging about, a dead cockatoo trapped in his car.
